poem:
Title: Light Catchers of Absurdity

The projector purrs in Dupieux's quiet corner,
Miscasting shadows of laughter and dismay.
Gentle, eccentric tricks of cinematic artists,
Kervern and Delépine, dance alongside,
While Kaurismäki's muted mirth lurks in the backdrop.
Their films: silver-screened lullabies steeped in oddity,
Warming the frost-brimmed void of the many-eyed dark.
An ensemble bathed in melancholy, absurdity and the gallows' guffaw.
